etymologies: late Middle English (as a verb in scan (sense 3 of the verb)): from Latin scandere ‘climb’ (in late Latin ‘scan (verses)’), by analogy with the raising and lowering of one's foot when marking rhythm. From ‘analyze (meter)’ arose the senses ‘estimate the correctness of’ and ‘examine minutely’, which led to ‘look at searchingly’ (late 18th century)

definitions: look at all parts of (something) carefully in order to detect some feature

examples.text: he raised his binoculars to scan the coast

shortDefinitions: look at all parts of something carefully

definitions: look quickly but not very thoroughly through (a document or other text) in order to identify relevant information

examples.text: we scan the papers for news from the trouble spots
I scanned through the reference materials

shortDefinitions: look quickly but not very thoroughly through

definitions: cause (a surface, object, or part of the body) to be traversed by a detector or an electromagnetic beam

examples.text: their brains are scanned so that researchers can monitor the progress of the disease

shortDefinitions: cause to be traversed by detector or electromagnetic beam

definitions: cause (a beam) to traverse across a surface or object

examples.text: we scanned the beam over a sector of 120°

shortDefinitions: cause beam to traverse across surface or object

definitions: convert (a document or picture) into digital form for storage or processing on a computer

examples.text: text and pictures can be scanned into the computer

shortDefinitions: convert document or picture into digital form for storage or processing on computer

definitions: resolve (a picture) into its elements of light and shade in a prearranged pattern for the purposes of television transmission.
shortDefinitions: resolve picture into its elements of light and shade in prearranged pattern for purposes of television transmission

definitions: analyze the meter of (a line of verse) by reading with the emphasis on its rhythm or by examining the pattern of feet or syllables.
shortDefinitions: analyse metre of line of verse by reading with emphasis on its rhythm or by examining pattern of feet or syllables

examples.text: well, it doesn't rhyme and certainly doesn't scan

definitions: an act of scanning someone or something

examples.text: a quick scan of the sports page

shortDefinitions: act of scanning person or thing

definitions: a medical examination using a scanner
an image obtained by scanning or with a scanner

examples.text: we can't predict anything until we have seen the scan

shortDefinitions: image obtained by scanning or with scanner
